Comedy.title: The Steak Network
Comedy.desc: The Steak Network is “Instagram for steaks” using the Proof of Steak protocol which can be used to incentivize and curate a decentralized registry. I raised $15k in donations to second-layer Ethereum projects.

Comedy.title: Send Crypto People Tulips
Comedy.desc: Automatically text your crypto friends pictures of tulips when the bubble bursts. Relish in the fact that You Were Right™

Comedy.title: We Know Art
Comedy.desc: An audio tour app for the MET where comedians grossly misinterpret art.

extra.name: We Know Art on the App Store

Comedy.title: Settl
Comedy.desc: It's like Tinder, but perfectly suited to your millennial lifestyle. settl matches you with everyone in the app. Try to swipe left and it won't let you. If you don't immediately start chatting with them, it'll turn on a bot to chat for you. It'll then find an available time in your calendar and schedule your date because it knows you're too sad to not go.

Comedy.title: How Many Rocks Are There And Where Are They
Comedy.desc: Take part in a massive multiplayer mobile experience designed to figure out how many rocks there are and where are they. It's Instagram for rocks, backed by real machine learning.

Comedy.title: asdfghjkl
Comedy.desc: asdfghjkl is the future of computer input devices; it turns your keyboard into a trackpad. Yea, really.

Comedy.title: /partyparrot
Comedy.desc: Produce startlingly annoying full-screen words made out of partyparrot emojis in slack.

Professional Experience.title: Skillshare
Professional Experience.desc: I led the SEO-focused growth engineering efforts, helped migrate to and establish the new Kubernetes-backed infrastructure (0-downtime deploys, centralized logging, etc), built a teacher-facing analytics dashboard, and helped minimize tech debt and establish best practices.

Professional Experience.title: Google
Professional Experience.desc: At Google I worked on Swift quickstarts for developers, wrote software for a bullet time rig made of Nexus 6 phones, and introduced Apps Script to the wonderful world of modern web development.

Professional Experience.title: HackNY Mentor
Professional Experience.desc: I mentored a group of 34 hackNY Fellows as they thrived in the NY tech scene. We spent the summer visiting startup offices, exploring the city, and hanging out.

Professional Experience.title: IFTTT
Professional Experience.desc: At IFTTT I worked on the platform team, building the partner-facing interface, including some baller analytics and metrics. I also shipped Two Factor Auth and tons of minor fixes.

Professional Experience.title: HackNY Fellow
Professional Experience.desc: At HackNY, I lived and worked in New York for a summer, hanging out with an amazing set of people and mentors. It was a fantastic experience, and I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

Professional Experience.title: Magnetic
Professional Experience.desc: At Magnetic, another intern and I built out a new method of gleaning context from pageviews. Relevant information is automatically harvested when a user loads the page, massively increasing the amount and quality of information Magnetic can use to do intelligent ad bidding.

Professional Experience.title: Grooveshark
Professional Experience.desc: At Grooveshark, I managed and developed a user-friendly analytics dashboard. I also learned a lot about team programming and project management by taking over an existing project and working with experienced developers.

Projects.title: Kickback
Projects.desc: Effortless, fire-and-forget, Amazon refunds when prices change. Kickback tracks everything you buy from Amazon and automagically gets your refunds when the price drops.

Projects.title: Fivestar
Projects.desc: Fivestar gives the user the best Amazon product available, broken down by budget. It was featured on TechCrunch.

Projects.title: Raffie
Projects.desc: Raffie was a Venmo-based bot that conducted raffles. Participants could send @raffle a dollar and be entered into the raffle. When 20 people entered, one person would get $20! It was shut down in 3 hours, thanks Venmo.

Projects.title: Grooveshark Analytics Dashboard
Projects.desc: At Grooveshark, I managed and developed a user-friendly analytics dashboard. I also learned a lot about team programming and project management by taking over an existing project and working with experienced developers.

Projects.title: gslash
Projects.desc: Chrome extension that adds "cmd-/" as a shortcut to focus the main search box on arbitrary pages.

Projects.title: Coinmap.org Contribution
Projects.desc: I added multi-currency support to Coinmap.

Projects.title: Askey
Projects.desc: Askey is an iOS keyboard that turns doodles into ASCII-text drawings. It works most of the time. Give it a download if you want your friends to think you spent a lot of time drawing out some incredible ASCII art for them.

Projects.title: Bitter
Projects.desc: Bitter ("One Bit Twitter") is like Reddit for the physical world. Upvote and downvote arbitrary locations on planet earth. Won sponsor prizes at AngelHack Manhattan.

Projects.title: skiff
Projects.desc: skiff is a DigitalOcean Python library for their v2 API. DigitalOcean sent me a t-shirt and card as thanks.

Projects.title: MCBouncyButton
Projects.desc: A delightfully bouncy button with 91+ stars on GitHub.

Projects.title: Jump - Leap Motion on iOS
Projects.desc: Jump lets iOS developers integrate Leap Motion gestures into their app with a few lines of code. Users can use their Leap to control a supporting app or even their entire OS UI. Won second place at GeauxHack 2014!

Projects.title: Express on Rails, AKA #2TRAINZ
Projects.desc: At hackNY Fall 2014, I attached an Intel Edison to a model train that navigated between rooms, collecting environmental sensor data. We then piped the data to a server to be displayed in real time on a web app. To be clear, the server is in Express and the train is on rails.

Projects.title: Googiri
Projects.desc: This Cydia tweak (a modification for jailbroken iOS devices) allows users to use Google Now's spectacular speech-to-text service with Siri's 1st party integration features.

Projects.title: Make it Rain Venmo
Projects.desc: Make it Rain Venmo lets the user simulate "Making it Rain" when sending money to friends via Venmo. You, too, can be the baller you always wished you were!

Projects.title: stacks - iOS Tweak in the Spirit of OSX
Projects.desc: stacks is a Cydia tweak that allows users to place stacks of apps on top of another one in the dock (shown via a quick swipe up), much like OS X.

Projects.title: MessageSwiper
Projects.desc: This Cydia tweak (a modification for jailbroken iOS devices) allows users to quickly swipe between message threads in their messaging applications.

Projects.title: Home Automation Proof of Concept
Projects.desc: I implemented a naive version of Jarvis from Iron Man. You communicate with him through computers, smartwatches, and phones over HTTP and the AI will intelligently route commands to wireless nodes, instructing them to flip switches or turn on motors. It has a party mode, obviously.

Projects.title: Mesh Network Over RF
Projects.desc: For my Home Automation implementation, I built a mesh network over RF that used multiple nodes to pass messages between leaves and the root node. The node pictured switches 120VAC for a light bulb.

Projects.title: Autonomous, Maze-Solving Arduino Bot
Projects.desc: Fully autonomous Arduino path-finding robot using Depth-First-Search. The build includes a dual H-bridge motor controller setup, along with a custom, recursive path-finding algorithm. The bot is able to solve any maze of infinite size, given infinite time, memory, and energy. So maybe not every maze. But a good many of them, for sure.

Projects.title: Billboard Top Hat
Projects.desc: This is a top hat equipped with 150 individual RGB LEDs which react to music in the environment. Uses a Fourier Transform algorithm to identify bass frequencies and flashes accordingly. Uses custom display driver to display animations.
